intro: Candollea desmophylla, commonly known as the desert hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to red. The plant has thick, fleshy leaves and stems that help it conserve water in its harsh environment. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, flat seeds. Candollea desmophylla is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
